title: Nasdaq Composite closes in correction for first time since March as stocks extend slide
text:
The Nasdaq Composite closed down 1.2% to reach 14,340, sinking more than 10% from its Nov. 19 peak and meeting the commonly used definition for a correction.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA closed around 340 points, or 1%, lower at 35,029, on a preliminary basis, weighed by losses in Boeing Co.BA, Caterpillar Inc.CAT and Goldman Sachs Group Inc.GS

The S&P 500 index SPX closed 44 points, or 1%, lower at about 4,532. Consumer discretionary sectorXX:SP500.25 led losses, down 1.8%, followed by a 1.7% decline in financialsXX:SP500.40.
